intro: Boehmeria spicigera, commonly known as the Chinese nettle or white flax, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, giving it its specific epithet "spicigera."
